intro: Flueggea jullienii, commonly known as the Jullien's flueggea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or small tree. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings, though it is not widely popular.
